identificationModule.briefTitle: Trial to Assess Long-term Lacosamide (LCM) Monotherapy Use and Safety of LCM Monotherapy and Adjunctive Therapy for Partial-onset Seizures
identificationModule.officialTitle: A Multicenter, Open-label Extension Trial to Assess the Long-term Use of Lacosamide Monotherapy and Safety of Lacosamide Monotherapy and Adjunctive Therapy in Subjects With Partial-onset Seizures

descriptionModule.briefSummary: This open-label extension trial will assess the long-term use of Lacosamide monotherapy and safety of Lacosamide monotherapy and adjunctive therapy in subjects with partial-onset seizures who were previously enrolled in the conversion to monotherapy trial (SP902).

interventions.name: Lacosamide
interventions.description: 50 mg and 100 mg Lacosamide tablets taken for 50 -400 mg twice daily dosing for up to 2 years

primaryOutcomes.measure: Percentage of Subjects on Lacosamide (LCM) Monotherapy at Any Time Between Visit 1 and End of Study
primaryOutcomes.description: Percentage of Subjects on Lacosamide (LCM) Monotherapy at any time between Visit 1 and End of Study.
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: From Visit 1 to End of Study (approximately 2 years)

primaryOutcomes.measure: Duration of Lacosamide (LCM) Monotherapy Treatment From Visit 1 to End of Study
primaryOutcomes.description: Duration of total Lacosamide Monotherapy From Visit 1 to End of Study.
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: From Visit 1 to End of Study (approximately 2 years)

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Occurrence of At Least One Treatment-Emergent Adverse Event (TEAE) From Visit 1 to End of Study
secondaryOutcomes.description:
A TEAE is defined as any untoward medical occurrence (eg, noxious or pathological changes) in a subject or clinical investigation subject compared with pre-existing conditions, that occurs during any phase of a clinical trial including Pretreatment, Run-In, Wash-Out, or Follow-Up Phases.

An TEAE is defined as being independent of assumption of any causality (eg, to trial or concomitant medication, primary or concomitant disease, or trial design).
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: From Visit 1 to End of Study (approximately 2 years)

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Occurrence of Treatment-Emergent Adverse Events (TEAE) Leading to Subject Withdrawal From Visit 1 to End of Study
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: From Visit 1 to End of Study (approximately 2 years)

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Subject has entered the Maintenance Phase of the double-blind trial, SP902, (ie, has taken at least 1 dose of SP902 Maintenance Phase trial medication) and either completed SP902 or met an exit criterion in SP902; subject is allowed up to 2 concomitant Antiepileptic Drugs (AEDs)

Exclusion Criteria:

* Subject meets the withdrawal criteria (excluding exit criteria) for the SP902 trial, or is experiencing an ongoing Serious Adverse Event (SAE)

participantFlowModule.preAssignmentDetails: Participant Flow refers to the Safety Set, which is defined as all subjects who met the inclusion/exclusion criteria, signed an informed consent form, and took at least 1 dose of Trial medication.
participantFlowModule.recruitmentDetails: This Multicenter, Open-Label Study started to enroll Subjects in February 2008.

baselineCharacteristicsModule.populationDescription: Baseline Characteristics refer to the Safety Set, which is defined as all subjects who met the inclusion/exclusion criteria, signed an informed consent form, and took at least 1 dose of Trial medication.

outcomeMeasures.title: Percentage of Subjects on Lacosamide (LCM) Monotherapy at Any Time Between Visit 1 and End of Study
outcomeMeasures.description: Percentage of Subjects on Lacosamide (LCM) Monotherapy at any time between Visit 1 and End of Study.
outcomeMeasures.populationDescription: All 322 Subjects from the Safety Set are included in the Analysis of this Outcome Measure. Safety Set is defined as all subjects who met the inclusion/exclusion criteria, signed an informed consent form, and took at least 1 dose of Trial medication.
outcomeMeasures.timeFrame: From Visit 1 to End of Study (approximately 2 years)

A TEAE is defined as any untoward medical occurrence (eg, noxious or pathological changes) in a subject or clinical investigation subject compared with pre-existing conditions, that occurs during any phase of a clinical trial including Pretreatment, Run-In, Wash-Out, or Follow-Up Phases.

An TEAE is defined as being independent of assumption of any causality (eg, to trial or concomitant medication, primary or concomitant disease, or trial design).

adverseEventsModule.timeFrame: Adverse Events were collected from Study Start (Visit 1) until the End of Study (up to 2 years).
adverseEventsModule.description: Adverse Events refer to the Safety Set, which is defined as all subjects who met the inclusion/exclusion criteria, signed an informed consent form, and took at least 1 dose of Trial medication.

seriousEvents.organSystem: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)
